data.title: Picnic Spots Near Kolkata That You Ought To Visit In 2024!
data.meta_description: Explore a location away from the bustling crowd by checking out the list of picnic spots near Kolkata where you can head out with your family and friends.
data.text:
A visit to the South City Mall, having jhal muri at Outram Ghat, tanga ride near Victoria Memorial, and some retail therapy in New Market more or less sums up a typical weekend chore of a born-bong. But nothing beats the heart’s desire to explore places far from the madding crowd that makes for awesome picnic spots near Kolkata . Some exclusive family time, potluck, roadside tea, and pictures for family albums sound just perfect. Take a glance at these one day picnic spot near Kolkata and figure out which one to visit in the coming weekend.

24 Picnic Spots Near Kolkata

If you are looking for one-day outing near Kolkata, then here are a few picnic spots that you can head to with your family and folks. Keep scrolling down and read along to know more about these amazing picnic spots near Kolkata for an enticing vacay.

Santragachi Lake: Relax Amidst Serenity

Barrackpore: For Picturesque Sunsets

Bawali: For A Fun-Packed Outing

Babur Haat: For A Tranquil Escape

Raichak: The Stunning Town

Falta: Take A Refreshing Walk

Chinsurah: An Abode Of Tourist Attractions

Diamond Harbour: Enjoy The Scenic View

Aqua Marina: Perfect For A Day Out With Your Kids

Deulti: Stay Amidst Rural Landscape

Taki: The Quaint Hamlet

Piyali Island: Witness Nature’s Charm

Gadiara: Go For A Boat Ride

Sunderban Tiger Camp: Spot Wild Animals

Parmadan: Savor The Lush Greens Views

Machranga Dwip: For Birdwatching Lovers

Frasergunj: An Alluring Spot

Junput: Take A Rejuvenating Break

Bishnupur: For Beautiful Landscapes

Shantiniketan: For Art Lovers

Tajpur: Try Kayaking And Zorbing

Susunia Hill: For Trekking Enthusiasts

Mukutmanipur: The Mesmerizing Spot

Ajodhya Hills: For All Rock Climbing Lovers

1. Santragachi Lake: Relax Amidst Serenity

Image Credit: Biswarup Ganguly for Wikimedia Commons

Santragachi Lake is the perfect offbeat picnic spot near Kolkata that is located in Santragachhi. Situated in the Howrah district, Santragachhi is a quaint neighbourhood that is well-known for its lake. If you are passionate about witnessing the different species of birds then Santragachi should be on your list. Santragachi Lake is one of the most beautiful lakes in West Bengal. You can head to this lake early morning or in the evening. The mesmerizing sight of sunrise and birds all around can be witnessed in the morning and in the evening you can enjoy the charming view of the sunset. This is ideal for one day tour near Kolkata within 50km.

Distance From Kolkata: 13 Km

How To Reach: You can hire a cab or take a local bus to Santragachi.

Attractions: Watch the beautiful sunrise and sunsets along with the birds

Best Time To Visit: November to February

Must Read: 101 Places To Visit In India Before You Turn 30

2. Barrackpore: For Picturesque Sunsets

Image Source

Quite close to Kolkata, only at a mere distance of 33 km, Barrackpore is a one-day picnic spot near Kolkata. The place has historical significance as it played an important role in the independence struggle, making it a famous tourist place. The spots to visit here are the Mangal Pandey Garden, Gandhi Ghat, and Annapurna Mandir.

Distance From Kolkata: 33 km

How To Reach: The place is connected via roads and there are buses which run from Sealdah.

Attractions: Mangal Pandey Garden Barrackpore, Gandhi Ghat, Jawahar Kunj, and Annapurna Mandir

Best Time To Visit: October to March

Entry fee: INR 15 per person.

Suggested Read: The Floating Market Comes Up In Kolkata Selling A Range Of Grocery On 114 Boats

3. Bawali: For A Fun-Packed Outing

Image Source

How about an overdose of serenity and a surplus of greenery on a Sunday? Bawali is the nearest tourist spot from Kolkata, offering both greenery and peace. Located very close to the ‘City of Joy’, Bawali is not only a famous picnic spot near Kolkata but is also the nearest picnic spot from Kolkata that offers joy, fun, and thrill.

Distance From Kolkata: 35 km

How To Reach: 1 hour 40 minutes drive

Attractions: Nature walk through the village, Fish farming, and the Rajbari Palace

Best Time To Visit: Throughout the year

Entry fee: Room rent plus 200 (per person)

Suggested Read: Best Street Food In Kolkata: 15 Dishes You Must Try In The City Of Joy

Looking To Book A Holiday Package?

4. Babur Haat: For A Tranquil Escape

Image Source

Spend a rustic and traditional day in a rural backdrop. The quaint village of Babur Haat in North 24 Parganas is one of the great options for one day trip near Kolkata, which must be visited for a different yet quite exotic taste. Enjoy this one day tour from Kolkata with your families and friends for a quiet refreshing break.

Distance From Kolkata: 48 km

How To Reach: 2 hours’ drive

Attractions: The fishing lakes maintained by local farmers who breed different species of Bengali fish naturally

Best Time To Visit: Early summers

Suggested Read: 33 Best Things To Do In Kolkata: Know What Makes It The City Of Joy

5. Raichak: The Stunning Town

Image Source

Raichak is a small town on the banks of the Bhagirathi-Hooghly River, well-known and popular as a one-day picnic spot near Kolkata. The luxurious resort near Kolkata right beside the river has enhanced the convenience, glamour and elegance of the picnic area.

Distance From Kolkata: 50 km

How To Reach: A drive for 2 and a half hours

Attractions: A sumptuous lunch at Fort Raichak and a relaxing boat ride from Raichak jetty

Best Time To Visit: October and March

Suggested Read: 15 Resorts Near Kolkata That Will Enthrall You With Their Charm

6. Falta: Take A Refreshing Walk

At the confluence of Hooghly, Damodar, and Rupnarayan is Falta, the best picnic spot in Kolkata. One can have a great time at the banks of the river and watch the sunrise and sunset. Spend some quality time with your loved ones at the riverside near Kolkata. One can also enjoy ferry rides here, other than strolling along the shores. Visit Falta for the best one day tour near Kolkata within 50 km.

Distance From Kolkata: 50 km

How To Reach: Falta is connected via trains, or one can also drive down.

Attractions: Take a ferry ride and enjoy a serene riverside walk

Best Time To Visit: All around the year

Suggested Read: 18 Historical Places In Kolkata That’ll Walk You Through City’s Artistic & Architectural Grandeur

7. Chinsurah: An Abode Of Tourist Attractions

Image Source

Chinsurah is a great one-day picnic spot near Kolkata since it is located by the banks of the mighty Hooghly River. It is a small town located in the Hooghly district. Being one of the most beautiful places in Kolkata, it draws a huge crowd of people who come here to enjoy the enchanting beauty. A plethora of architectural marvels like mosques, churches, and old buildings adorn the landscape.

Distance From Kolkata: 53 km

How To Reach: There are a number of trains between Kolkata and Chinsurah (Chuchura).

Attractions: Hangseshwari Temple, Chinsurah Dutch Cemetery, Hooghly Imambara

Best Time To Visit: October – March

Suggested Read: 11 Lavish Resorts In Kolkata For A Comfortable Yet Memorable Stay

8. Diamond Harbour: Enjoy The Scenic View

Image Source

The place where Ganga meets the Bay of Bengal can be a place for your Sunday picnic too. It is the best picnic spot in Kolkata riverside. Travel to Diamond harbour to view the broad and magnificent river often confused as the sea. And yes, you will be close to the largest delta in the world.

Distance From Kolkata: 57.5 km

How To Reach: A drive for 2 and a half hours

Attractions: The abundant fort, riverbank, boat ride, and the mouth-watering Hilsa in nearby restaurants in monsoons

Best Time To Visit: October – March

Suggested Read: Nightlife In Kolkata: 20 Places That Make The City Of Joy More Joyful Post Sundown

9. Aqua Marina: Perfect For A Day Out With Your Kids

Image Credit: aquamarinapark.com

Aqua Marina is one of the best picnic spots near Kolkata that you can visit to beat the summer heat. If you are planning for a fun-packed picnic with your kids then Aqua Marina is undoubtedly the best choice. From several enticing rides to an impeccable restaurant, Aqua Marina has everything that will make your outing extra-special. Aqua Marine is located in the Hooghly district and is home to pools and gardens where you can spend time with your family.

Distance From Kolkata: 61 Km

How To Reach: You can hire a cab and reach Aqua Marina in around 1 hour 30 minutes.

Attractions: Bandel Church, Dutch cemetery Chinsura, Tomb of Susanna Anna Maria

Best Time To Visit: Summer season

Entry fee: INR 200 (adults), INR 10 (children)

Suggested Read: 20 Best Wedding Venues In Kolkata That Define Extravaganza

10. Deulti: Stay Amidst Rural Landscape

Image Source

If you are looking for a perfect getaway, then Deulti is an option for short trip near Kolkata for 1 day. It will be complete bliss to spend one of the weekend days in a rural landscape. The green coconut trees, winding clayey roads, thatch-roofed huts, and crystal clear fishing ponds make Deulti one of the best picnic spots near Kolkata for one day.

Distance From Kolkata: 63 km

How To Reach: 1 hour 25 minutes drive.

Attractions: Nirala resort, Subarnarekha Riverbank, and the age-old residence (now a heritage property) of the very famous Bengali writer – Sarat Chandra Chattopadhyay

Best Time To Visit: All around the year

Suggested Read: 21 Surreal Hill Stations Near Kolkata For A Rejuvenating Weekend Getaway

11. Taki: The Quaint Hamlet

Image Source

Located on the banks of the river Ichamati, Takei is a little hamlet that gives a glimpse of Bangladesh. You can even take a boat ride from this place to meet some Bangladeshis. Due to its serenity, many people from Kolkata travel to Taki with their families and spend some quality time. Moreover, some local attraction is an add on which makes this destination perfect for a one day trip near Kolkata for couples.

Distance From Kolkata: 67 km

How To Reach: Take a train to Hasnabad or drive for 2 hours and 30 minutes to reach Taki from Kolkata.

Attractions: Taki Eco Park, Mansion Puberabari, and indulge in boating

Best Time To Visit: Winter season

Entry fee:

Suggested Read: 60 Best Places To Visit In Kolkata That Reflect Its True Art

12. Piyali Island: Witness Nature’s Charm

Image Source

Piyali Island is another option for a one-day picnic spot near Kolkata that one can resort to easily. The island is connected to the mainland over River Piyali. People who love to witness some beautiful nature places would love to visit Piyali Island. People travelling to this island often go to the famous Sundarban Tiger Camp which is located nearby.

Distance From Kolkata: 70 km

How To Reach: This can be easily reached by hiring a car or by taking a train to South Barasat Station.

Attractions: Netidhopani WatchTower and Sundarban National Park

Best Time To Visit: October to March

Suggested Read: New Rail Line Between Agartala And Kolkata Will Reduce Travel-Time By 21 Hours

13. Gadiara: Go For A Boat Ride

Image Source

Gadiara is another amazing picnic spot near Kolkata that one can resort to for a day trip. Gadiara is a city away from the daily hustle-bustle of Kolkata. One can actually experience a combination of tranquillity and peace here. Gadiara proves to be an amazing spot due to the variety of activities that it offers like boating and nature walks. What more? Well, Gadiara is famous for its exceptional cuisine. So, make sure that you do not miss out on some of the famous dishes here. It is a perfect spot for a day outing in Kolkata.

Distance From Kolkata: 77 km

How To Reach: Either you can hire a car to reach the destination directly or you can also take a train from Howrah to Bagnan and take a bus from there to reach Shyampur.

Attractions: Indulge in boating and nature walks

Best Time To Visit: All around the year

Entry fee: INR 10 per person

Suggested Read: 20 Best Wedding Venues In Kolkata That Define Extravaganza

14. Sunderban Tiger Camp: Spot Wild Animals

Image Source

This is not the place that you would want to miss in the world. Sundarban Tiger Camp is visited by thousands of nature and animal lovers where one can obviously see some tigers that are being taken care of in the park. What more? There are some watchtowers in the park that give unparalleled views of the forest and animals. You can drop your bags in the camp and stroll around to explore the nearby area of the forest on your own.

Distance From Kolkata: 98.6 km

How To Reach: The tiger camp can be reached by car or by taking a train to South Barasat Station.

Attractions: Explore the forest, watch animals in their natural habitat, and camping

Best Time To Visit: October to March

Suggested Read: 40 Thrilling Weekend Getaways From Kolkata You Must Visit

Planning your holiday but confused about where to go? These travel stories help you find your best trip ever

15. Parmadan: Savor The Lush Greens Views

Image Source

Parmadan is a perfect spot if you want a one-day outing near Kolkata. The lush greenery of Parmadan forest will fill your lungs with fresh air and leave your soul reinvigorated. For those who enjoy nature walks, there could not be a perfect place to enjoy a picnic. You could observe the ecosystem and even make a visit to the Indo-Bangladeshi border. You might even spot a deer as the forest has a healthy population. It is one of the best tourist places near Kolkata within 150 km.

Distance From Kolkata: 103 km

How To Reach: Take a train from Kolkata to Ranaghat and then take a bus to Naldungri. You could avoid all the fuss and take a taxi directly to the forest. Opt for the route via Highway 34.

Attractions: Indo-Bangladesh Border

Best Time To Visit: Winter season

Suggested Read: 10 Best Churches In Kolkata That Beautifully Reflects The Spiritual Essence

16. Machranga Dwip: For Birdwatching Lovers

Image Source

Literally meaning the island of kingfisher birds, the not so famous island is situated between Ichhamati and Bhasa River with India on one side and Bangladesh on the other. Visiting this place promises one thing for sure which is you will barely hear anything except the continuous chirping of innumerable birds.

Distance From Kolkata: 113 km

How To Reach: From Taki or Hasnabad in North 24 Parganas, hire a local boat to reach the island.

Attractions: Nature walk, outdoor picnic, watching the sunset, and bird watching

Best Time To Visit: All around the year

Entry fee: INR 5 per head

Suggested Read: The Ultimate Weekend Getaway Bucket List From Kolkata

17. Frasergunj: An Alluring Spot

Image Source

Frasergunj is a place very close to the ‘Mohana’ or delta and offers a very soothing and comfortable ambience for a day outing. If you are looking for picnic spots near Kolkata besides the river, Frasergunj could well be a considerable option. Be it chilling with friends, spending time with family, or watching a sunset with your loved one, this place is just perfect for everyone.

Distance From Kolkata: 125 km

How To Reach: A drive for 3 and a half hours. Luxury buses of WBSTC ply frequently to Frasergunj.

Attractions: Jammu Dwip- an isolated riverine island

Best Time To Visit: July to March

Suggested Read: UAE Tourism Holds An Exclusive Abu Dhabi Week In Kochi And Kolkata For Indian Travelers

18. Junput: Take A Rejuvenating Break

Image Source

If the major motive behind Sunday travel is exclusivity and tranquillity, Junput is a tailor-made option for one and for all. With a serene and almost virgin beach, Junput surely tops the list of peaceful beach picnic spots near Kolkata that offers calm and quiet environs to revive your energies on a weekend, away from the hustle and bustle of the city clutter.

Distance From Kolkata: 138 km

How To Reach: Drive along the road heading to Digha. Reach Kathi and Junput is 9 km from there.

Attractions: Beach walks, fish fry at shacks, surfing, and sea bathing

Best Time To Visit: All around the year

Suggested Read: Our Andaman Trip From Kolkata Was A Combo Of Bliss And Adventure

19. Bishnupur: For Beautiful Landscapes

Image Source

Get overwhelmed by the rich culture and heritage of Bishnupur, a place near Kolkata perfect for a day picnic. Malla Dynasty shaped today’s Bishnupur in the 17th century and that can be seen in the tourist places at this place. Do not forget to explore the terracotta temples and buy Baluchari sarees which are famous in this region. Make sure that you are carrying your camera so that you will be able to capture some beautiful landscapes.

Distance From Kolkata: 138 km

How To Reach: The best way to reach Bishnupur from Kolkata is to take Howrah Express. You can also hire a direct taxi to reach within 3 hours.

Attractions: Jor Bangla Temple, Lalaji Temple, Madan Mohan Temple, and Kalachand Temple

Best Time To Visit: October to March

Entry fee: INR 20 (Indians) and INR 250 (Foreigners)

Suggested Read: 29 Best Romantic Restaurants In Kolkata For A Date To Remember

20. Shantiniketan: For Art Lovers

Image Source

A trip to West Bengal is incomplete without visiting the abode of the famous writer, Rabindranath Tagore. Also popular as the cultural capital of the region, Shantiniketan is a place to enjoy some good music and watch classical dance performances. From art galleries to museums, this place can keep anyone occupied for a full day. So, if you are looking for a peaceful retreat near Kolkata then your search is over. It is a great spot for a day outing in Kolkata.

Distance From Kolkata: 162 km

How To Reach: There are three ways to cover this distance, one is by bus, second is by train from Howrah to Prantik, and third, by renting a car.

Attractions: Tagore’s Ashram, Amar Kutir, Khoai Mela, Kala Bhavan, and Poush Mela

Best Time To Visit: All around the year

Suggested Read: Kolkata Is Officially The Best City For Street Food In India! Surprised Much?

21. Tajpur: Try Kayaking And Zorbing

Image Source

Looking for a secluded picnic spot near Kolkata? Fret not, because we have an option for you. Tajpur is the newest place to explore in West Bengal which has carved out a niche in the tourism sector. It is a tourist spot for adventure junkies as the place is loaded with several activities that one can indulge in like zorbing, rafting, paragliding, and kayaking. Moreover, the serenity of this place along with a cool breeze makes this place a perfect destination for a picnic.

Distance From Kolkata: 172 km

How To Reach: Hire a taxi to reach Tajpur directly or take a seat on the train from Howrah to Digha Station.

Attractions: Tajpur Beach and Mandarmani Beach

Best Time To Visit: All around the year

Suggested Read: 29 Super Romantic Places In Kolkata For Couples Hit By Cupid’s Bow

22. Susunia Hill: For Trekking Enthusiasts

Image Source

Perched at a height of 1442 feet, Susunia Hill is one of the most famous picnic spots near Kolkata that no one can afford to miss. The entire hill is covered with flora, some rare medicinal plants, and beautiful shrubbery. This spot gives a chance to indulge in trekking and climbing which is why it comes to the top of the to-do list of adventure seekers. Spending a weekend here is an ideal way to escape from the noise of the city.

Distance From Kolkata: 218 km

How To Reach: You can either hire a direct taxi or can take a train from Howrah to Chhatna Station which is just 10 kilometres away from Susunia Hill.

Attractions: Go for activities like trekking, climbing, and camping

Best Time To Visit: October to March

Suggested Read: 8 Best Cruises To Andaman: Guide To Fares And Ferries From Kolkata, Chennai And Vizag

23. Mukutmanipur: The Mesmerizing Spot

Image Source

Preferred by many travellers, Mukutmanipur is another best pick from the list of top picnic spots near Kolkata. This place is not only a picturesque escape to nature but also keeps the interested people occupied with the number of tourist attractions in the region. With several nature parks, temples, and viewpoints, Mukutmanipur proves to be another best picnic spot near Kolkata.

Distance From Kolkata: 263 km

How To Reach: One can take a train from Howrah to Bankura railway station which is about 52 kilometres away from Mukutmanipur which can be covered by a cab.

Attractions: Mukutmanipur Dam, Mukutmanipur Children Park, Kangsabati Dam, and Mukutmanipur Lake

Best Time To Visit: October to March

Suggested Read: 13 Delightful Honeymoon Places Near Kolkata That Will Add To The Romance

24. Ajodhya Hills: For All Rock Climbing Lovers

Image Source

Nestled in the famous Purulia District, Ajodhya Hills prove to be another famous picnic spot near Kolkata that one can explore on a weekend. Ajodhya Hill is a tall mountain with tableland on top with many small streams flowing through the slopes and ultimately merging into Kumari & Kangsabati in the north and Subarnarekha in the west. This place gives a chance to indulge in some adventurous activities like mountaineering and rock climbing.

Distance From Kolkata: 325 km

How To Reach: One of the best ways to reach Ajodhya Hills is to take a train from Howrah to Adra and from there board a bus to Raghunathpur.

Attractions: Bamni Falls, Pakhi Pahar, Khairabera Dam, and Murguma Dam

Best Time To Visit: October to March

Further Read: 11 Most Haunted Places In Kolkata And Associated Real Ghost Stories

So, why spend weekends visiting the picnic spots in Kolkata over and over again, when there are so many amazing nearby places to break the monotony. Wait no more and plan your trip to Kolkata

For our editorial codes of conduct and copyright disclaimer, please click here.

Frequently Asked Questions About Picnic Spots Near Kolkata

What is the best time to visit Kolkata?

Being a coastal area, the best time to visit Kolkata would be from the months of October to March, which happens to be the onset of the autumn season and the humidity is considerably low.

Are there any more picnic spots near Kolkata?

Taki, Bishnupur, Sanhati Park, Gadiara, Parmadan, and Shanti Sarovar Lake are some of the other interesting picnic spots near Kolkata.

Which are the best picnic spots near Kolkata within 30 kilometers?

The best picnic spots near Kolkata within 30 kilometers are Bawali and Barrackpore where you can spend some quality time with your family.

Which are the most popular one day picnic spots near Kolkata?

Some of the most popular one-day spots near Kolkata are Bawalli, Barrackpore, Raichak, and Babur Haat.

How can I go to Babur Haat?

As Babur Haat is well-linked via road with Kolkata, one can avail bus services or rent a car from Minakha and reach Babur Haat via the Basanti Highway.

How do you get to Deulti?

Deulti Station is located just 50 kilometers away from Howrah Junction which can be covered in 1 hour and 30 minutes via local trains like Kharagpur local, Mecheda local, and Paskura local.

How do I get to Machranga Dwip?

One of the best ways to reach Machranga DWIP is by reaching Hasnabad from Kolkata and covering a distance of 75 kilometers. After this, one has to hire a motorboat to reach Machranga Dwip.
